alert.note: Alert for Cambria; Somerset (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Advisory issued March 03 at 4:29AM EST until March 03 at 10:00PM EST by NWS State College
info.description: ...WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 2 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 10 PM EST THIS EVENING... ...HIGH WIND WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...For the Wind Advisory, southeast winds 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 55 mph expected. For the High Wind Watch, winds shifting to the west at 20 to 30 mph by daybreak Saturday with gusts up to 60 mph possible, mainly during the morning hours Saturday. * WHERE...Cambria and Somerset Counties. * WHEN...For the Wind Advisory, from 2 PM this afternoon to 10 PM EST this evening. For the High Wind Watch, from 4 am Saturday through Saturday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Damaging winds could blow down trees and power lines. Widespread power outages are possible. Travel could be difficult, especially for high profile vehicles.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts and warnings for updates on this situation. Fasten loose objects or shelter objects in a safe location prior to the onset of winds. For high wind safety and preparedness information, visit weather.gov/wind. The latest forecast information can be found on the NWS State College Facebook page and Twitter @NWSStateCollege, or on the web at weather.gov/ctp.
